title.narrative: Fruits value chain finance project in Burundi

description.narrative: In Burundi, the "fruit" sector has huge advantages because of the variety of possible productions and favorable characteristics of the production areas. Over the last decade a number of entrepreneurs have emerged from this sector specializing at different levels of the various activities. Caritas has been a supporter and accompanied this development and has brought a new approach to it by encouraging a value chain development approach to the enhancement of the “fruit” sector. Nonetheless according to the latest survey of the state of fruits value chain in Burundi (Onudi 2014), a number of bottlenecks are still restraining the development and optimization of the potential of this chain. These are the lack of skills, equipments, and institutional support among many others. In their recommendations, four areas of action have been proposed: training support, technical support, institutional support and material support. This project will aim at addressing some of these issues. An emphasis will be on a direct input to entrepreneurs with high leverage potential, the governance of the chain, lessons from more developed fruits chains in the region and institutional lobby for battening the environment. One of the main challenges to address is the adequate access to packaging. A direct input is suggested as benchmark for the rest of actors as to see alternatives that are possible. This will be a business partnership between neighboring country Tanzania packaging firm and a Burundian fruits transformation company. The company has been chosen for its existing linkages with the main fruits producers cooperative of Burundi, its considerable growth potential, professionalism and active role in the initiative of a chain governance and inter-professional body. An institutional support will be also given to the governance body of the fruits chain in Burundi by supporting various round tables and learning experiences from other countries.
